commit_message:
Fix issue with ceph-client relation handling

A bug was introduced when changing ceph-client to
an operator framework library that caused the
fallback application_name handling to present
a class name rather than a remote applicaiton name.

This change updates the handling to get at an
`app.name` rather than an `app`.

As a drive-by, this also allow-lists the fully-
qualified rename.sh.

Closes-Bug: #1995086
Change-Id: I57b685cb78ba5c4930eb0fa73d7ef09d39d73743
func-test-pr: https://github.com/openstack-charmers/zaza-openstack-tests/pull/1022

commit_message:
Rehome functions to enable Neutron's segments integration

Those functions were part of the neutron devstack plugin but we
discussed it during last PTG [1] and decided to move to the Devstack
repo as plugins which are used by e.g. CI jobs which are defined outside
of the neutron repository.
Placement integration is used e.g. in the tempest-slow job which is
defined in tempest and used by many different OpenStack projects.

[1] https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/neutron-yoga-ptg#L142

Change-Id: I2c26063896ab2679cffd01227a40a3283caa3b17

commit_message:
[OVS] Allow custom ethertype traffic in the ingress table

This patch is a partial revert of [1], reinstantiating the code merged
in [2]. This patch is the complementary to [1]: the traffic with
custom ethertypes is allowed in the ingress processing tables, same
as [1] is allowing all traffic from the virtual machine ports in this
host to leave the node. Both, this patch and [1], are bypassing the
OVS firewall just for the traffic with the configured allowed
ethertypes and just for/to the local ports and MAC addresses.

Any other traffic not coming from a local port or with destination
a local port, will be blocked as is now.

[1]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/678021
[2]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/668224/

Closes-Bug: #2009221
Related-Bug: #1832758
Change-Id: Ib8340d9430b946a446edf80886c49fbac729073c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/63/876563/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Allow custom ethertypes for permitted_ethertype in self.permitted_ethertypes: if permitted_ethertype[:2] == '0x': try: hex_ethertype = hex(int(permitted_ethertype, base=16)) self._add_flow( table=ovs_consts.BASE_INGRESS_TABLE, priority=100, dl_type=hex_ethertype, reg_port=port.ofport, actions='output:{:d}'.format(port.ofport) ) continue except ValueError: pass LOG.warning('Custom ethertype %(permitted_ethertype)s is not ' 'a hexadecimal number.', {'permitted_ethertype': permitted_ethertype})

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/2023.1

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/2023.1 branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I462ec85c0f856ef0cb05592b65b1d7bbc7de8a4e

revisions:

In ``QoSMinimumBandwidthEvent`` and ``QoSBandwidthLimitEvent``, the

Change-Id: Idbb8f98eaa429601e2f16861eb01ad72c68cffa6

commit_message:
[OVN] Use the BW values retrieved from ``get_port_qos``

In ``QoSMinimumBandwidthEvent`` and ``QoSBandwidthLimitEvent``, the
bandwidth value is provided by the method ``get_port_qos``. This method
handles when the value to be retrieved is not present in the
required register and returns 0.

Closes-Bug: #2009703
Change-Id: Idbb8f98eaa429601e2f16861eb01ad72c68cffa6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/72/876872/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: LOG.debug(self.LOG_MSG, str(row.uuid), port_id, max_kbps, event) LOG.debug(self.LOG_MSG, row.name, min_kbps, event)
deleted_lines: max_bw_kbps = int(row.bandwidth['rate']) LOG.debug(self.LOG_MSG, str(row.uuid), port_id, max_bw_kbps, event) min_bw_kbps = int(row.options[ovn_const.LSP_OPTIONS_QOS_MIN_RATE]) LOG.debug(self.LOG_MSG, row.name, min_bw_kbps, event)

commit_message:
Fix wrong tcp port for heat-cfn endpoint with ssl

The heat-cfn api uses tcp/13005 for its public endpoint when ssl is
enabled. This corrects the wrong port in iptables rule.

Closes-Bug: #2003929
Change-Id: Ibb8037fad70c628ab26a6cf0dd4401bb6b23cc7c
(cherry picked from commit e98f23fd150886a2573dd5eb1f73677d62827433)

commit_message:
Make lint jobs non-voting

The current implementation is not compliant with the latest lint
packages. Because TripleO is being retired soon, instead of fixing
the job, let's make it non-voting so that we can merge some last-minute
changes.

Change-Id: I2225150e5489c60eebf7cea34f91c89ca64c2fec

bandit checks to the pep8 environment.

subject: [PooledLDAPHandler] Ensure result3() invokes message.clean()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-02-24 07:11:51.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/unit/test_backend_ldap_pool.py', 'keystone/identity/backends/ldap/common.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/fakeldap.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/8a383cbff91b2cc39b15e50ef0361b6875d4b847', 'message': '[PooledLDAPHandler] Ensure result3() invokes message.clean()

result3 does not invoke message.clean() when an exception is thrown
by `message.connection.result3()` call, causing pool connection
associated with the message to be marked active forever. This causes
a denial-of-service on ldappool.

The fix ensures message.clean() is invoked by wrapping the offending
call in try-except-finally and putting the message.clean() in finally
block.

Closes-Bug: #1998789

Change-Id: I59ebf0fa77391d49b2349e918fc55f96318c42a6
Signed-off-by: Mustafa Kemal Gilor <mustafa.gilor@canonical.com>
(cherry picked from commit ff632a81fb09e6d9f3298e494d53eb6df50269cf)
'}]
commit_message:
[PooledLDAPHandler] Ensure result3() invokes message.clean()

result3 does not invoke message.clean() when an exception is thrown
by `message.connection.result3()` call, causing pool connection
associated with the message to be marked active forever. This causes
a denial-of-service on ldappool.

The fix ensures message.clean() is invoked by wrapping the offending
call in try-except-finally and putting the message.clean() in finally
block.

Closes-Bug: #1998789

Change-Id: I59ebf0fa77391d49b2349e918fc55f96318c42a6
Signed-off-by: Mustafa Kemal Gilor <mustafa.gilor@canonical.com>
(cherry picked from commit ff632a81fb09e6d9f3298e494d53eb6df50269cf)

commit_message:
Fix user creation with GRANT in MySQL 8.0(Ubuntu Focal)

In Ubuntu Bionic (18.04) mysql 5.7 version used to create
the user implicitly when using using the GRANT.

Ubuntu Focal (20.04) has mysql 8.0 and with mysql 8.0 there
is no implicit user creation with GRANT. We need to
create the user first before using GRANT command.

This patch updates tools/test-setup.sh so that keystone supports
ubuntu focal.

Story: #2007865
Task: #40190

Change-Id: I86d10729cfc7c02f12df611b56f6e263969dfe4b
Closes-Bug: #1885825

commit_message:
ldap-backend: replace weakref with backports.weakref for python < 3.4

the ldap module uses weakref.finalize, which is lacking in python 2.7.
this patch adds the backports.weakref module, which contains a backport
of weakref.finalize() function from python 3.6.

Signed-off-by: Mustafa Kemal Gilor <mustafa.gilor@canonical.com>
Change-Id: I6e6126d403c4bc69ef318dcb57617a602e3faa68
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/56/876256/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if sys.version_info < (3, 4): from backports import weakref else: import weakref

commit_message:
OAuth 2.0 Mutual-TLS Support

The oauth2_mtls_token filter has been added for accepting or denying
incoming requests containing OAuth 2.0 certificate-bound access
tokens that are obtained from keystone identity server by users
through their OAuth 2.0 credentials and Mutual-TLS certificates.

Co-Authored-By: Hiromu Asahina <hiromu.asahina.az@hco.ntt.co.jp>
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/keystoneauth/+/860614
Change-Id: I49127d845954ad6eab39e6e6305948ef0e4ed7b5
Implements: blueprint support-oauth2-mtls
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystonemiddleware refs/changes/45/876745/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2022 OpenStack Foundation # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import base64 import hashlib import ssl import webob from oslo_log import log as logging from oslo_serialization import jsonutils from keystonemiddleware.auth_token import _user_plugin from keystonemiddleware.auth_token import AuthProtocol from keystonemiddleware import exceptions from keystonemiddleware.i18n import _ class OAuth2mTlsProtocol(AuthProtocol): """Middleware that handles OAuth2.0 mutual-TLS client authentication.""" def __init__(self, app, conf): log = logging.getLogger(conf.get('log_name', __name__)) log.info('Starting Keystone oauth2_mls_token middleware') super(OAuth2mTlsProtocol, self).__init__(app, conf) def _confirm_certificate_thumbprint(self, token_thumb, peer_cert): """Check if the thumbprint in the token is valid. :rtype: if the thumbprint is valid """ try: cert_pem = ssl.DER_cert_to_PEM_cert(peer_cert) thumb_sha256 = hashlib.sha256(cert_pem.encode('ascii')).digest() cert_thumb = base64.urlsafe_b64encode(thumb_sha256).decode('ascii') if cert_thumb == token_thumb: is_valid = True else: self.log.info('The two thumbprints do not match.') is_valid = False except Exception as error: self.log.exception(error) is_valid = False return is_valid def _is_valid_access_token(self, request): """Check the OAuth2.0 certificate-bound access token. :param request: Incoming request :rtype: if the access token is valid """ try: wsgi_input = request.environ.get("wsgi.input") if not wsgi_input: self.log.warn('Unable to obtain the client certificate.') return False sock = wsgi_input.get_socket() if not sock: self.log.warn('Unable to obtain the client certificate.') return False peer_cert = sock.getpeercert(binary_form=True) if not peer_cert: self.log.warn('Unable to obtain the client certificate.') return False except Exception as error: self.log.warn('Unable to obtain the client certificate. %s' % str(error)) return False access_token = None if (request.authorization and request.authorization.authtype == 'Bearer'): access_token = request.authorization.params if not access_token: self.log.info('Unable to obtain the token.') return False try: token_data, user_auth_ref = self._do_fetch_token( access_token, allow_expired=False) self._validate_token(user_auth_ref, allow_expired=False) token = token_data.get('token') oauth2_cred = token.get('oauth2_credential') if not oauth2_cred: self.log.info( 'Invalid OAuth2.0 certificate-bound access token: ' 'The token is not an OAuth2.0 credential access token.') return False token_thumb = oauth2_cred.get("x5t#S256") if self._confirm_certificate_thumbprint(token_thumb, peer_cert): self._confirm_token_bind(user_auth_ref, request) request.token_info = token_data request.token_auth = _user_plugin.UserAuthPlugin( user_auth_ref, None) return True else: self.log.info( 'Invalid OAuth2.0 certificate-bound access token: ' 'the access token dose not match the client certificate.') return False except exceptions.KeystoneMiddlewareException as err: self.log.info('Invalid OAuth2.0 certificate-bound access token: %s' % str(err)) return False def process_request(self, request): """Process request. :param request: Incoming request :type request: _request.AuthTokenRequest """ request.remove_auth_headers() self._token_cache.initialize(request.environ) if (not self._is_valid_access_token(request) or "keystone.token_info" not in request.environ or "token" not in request.environ["keystone.token_info"]): self.log.info('Rejecting request') message = _('The request you have made requires authentication.') body = {'error': { 'code': 401, 'title': 'Unauthorized', 'message': message, }} raise webob.exc.HTTPUnauthorized( body=jsonutils.dumps(body), headers=self._reject_auth_headers, charset='UTF-8', content_type='application/json') request.set_user_headers(request.token_auth.user) request.set_service_catalog_headers(request.token_auth.user) request.token_auth._auth = self._auth request.token_auth._session = self._session self.log.debug('Accepting request and inited all env fields.') def filter_factory(global_conf, **local_conf): """Return a WSGI filter app for use with paste.deploy.""" conf = global_conf.copy() conf.update(local_conf) def auth_filter(app): return OAuth2mTlsProtocol(app, conf) return auth_filter

commit_message:
Add CIP to distributed compute roles

When running DCN, it's necessary to include the DCN role during the
container image prepare step. Else the etcd containers will never be
cached on the undercloud registry. This change adds the
OS::TripleO::Services::ContainerImagePrepare service to each of the
distributed compute roles.

Closes-Bug: #2003811
Change-Id: I6932743cd0674d55075846b1e9d03d0513e7dc65

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-03-10 15:15:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/releases/commit/4681e525b10994d48ef204b4c24f45fe4ee22bca', 'message': "Fix gitutils to use release-id

it
still uses the release name. This patch fixes this by reading the
'release-id' field from series_status.yaml and if present then uses it
as stable/<release-id> for the branch creation.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/release-naming.html

Change-Id: I014b1d6dc561be4db0fc8faa85fb3133e851acfc
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2023-03-10 17:07:16.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_releases/tests/test_validate.py', 'openstack_releases/gitutils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/releases/commit/fb08afc1fa29664bf5e2abb6bd8c48cee87d8c5a', 'message': "Fix gitutils to use release-id

This patch fixes this by reading the 'release-id' field from

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/release-naming.html

Change-Id: I014b1d6dc561be4db0fc8faa85fb3133e851acfc

commit_message:
Fix gitutils to use release-id

With the new release identification / naming schema [1] (like:
2023.1 Antelope) new stable branch naming was introduced (like:
stable/2023.1). This was not handled in check_branch_sha method
in validate.py, as the method still searches stable/$series.

This patch fixes this by reading the 'release-id' field from
series_status.yaml if present and uses it as stable/<release-id>
for the branch search.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/release-naming.html

Change-Id: I014b1d6dc561be4db0fc8faa85fb3133e851acfc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/releases refs/changes/05/877105/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from openstack_releases import series_statusdef get_stable_branch_id(series): """Retrieve the stable branch ID of the series. Returns the release-id if the series has such field, otherwise returns the series name. This is needed for the new stable branch naming style: stable/2023.1 (versus the old style: stable/zed). """ series_status_data = series_status.SeriesStatus.default() release_id = series_status_data[series].release_id if release_id is None: release_id = series return str(release_id) remote_match = 'remotes/origin/stable/%s' % get_stable_branch_id(series)

commit_message:
Do not recalculate checksum if disk_format is not changed

Even if a glance image is raw, we still recalculate the checksum after
"converting" it to raw. This process may take exceptionally long.

Change-Id: Id93d518b8d2b8064ff901f1a0452abd825e366c0

commit_message:
Allow unwinding nova DB manage cron jobs

Add enablement flags to classes managing Nova DB records purging and
archieving. With that change, cron jobs can be removed, if no longer
needed. For example, when the cron jobs were originally enabled but
later will be disabled so that users can always restore any deleted
instances.

Co-authored-by: Takashi Kajinami <tkajinam@redhat.com>
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I4b2c65b91b83c7ac64f909359585aa76c19d4705

commit_message:
Fixes repositories files name in Rocky Linux 9

Distributions moved to lowercase names with RHEL 9 release.
This patch also removes previously created uppercase files.

Story: 2010637
Task: 47604

(cherry picked from commit e0ff9a0283bd870df72ea7dec62d55ef0b8ed972)

commit_message:
Fix iscsid.conf FIPS configuration

iscsid.conf isn't an ini file, iniset is incorrectly
adding a [DEFAULT] section to the file.

Change-Id: I2ce25c5e7b1d75ed9373cff976e865ca983c391a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/93/876593/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if ! sudo grep chap_algs /etc/iscsi/iscsi.conf; then echo "node.session.auth.chap_algs = SHA3-256,SHA256" | sudo tee -a /etc/iscsi/iscsid.conf fi

commit_message:
haproxy: Enable httplog for horizon endpoint

This is follow-up of 1a0b513423c378cc13ec982e5cb07ac87f0821e3 and
enables httplog for Horizon endpoint, so that operators can find L7
information about access to Horizon dashboard.

Related-Bug: #1930266
Change-Id: I4b20427a72a90a64e1ade0ca3fffe9a90aaae645

... instead of using puppet to create symlink.

commit_message:
Revert "Set owner/permissions on ~/.tripleo for tripleo deploy"

This reverts commit 8afa8a03548497c8c9bc89a38000230769840a1c.

Reason for revert:
The change is incomplete and does not resolve the same problem caused
by the other commands. We implemented the more complete fix so no
longer need this partial fix.

Change-Id: Ib06c33b2c460cbcb6ca2d4d8fe7229412e3b591f

commit_message:
image build: Fix ignored --authfile

This change fixes the ignored --authfile option in `tripleo container
image build`, by ensuring the given value is passed to the underlying
buildah command as the REGISTRY_AUTH_FILE environment.

This re-implements change Ib7beb1341bbbff3c15b191cf34102c3f7e252034
which was reverted later. This change only overrides the specific
environment instead of preserving the all environments.

To merge this change without t-c release, tox.ini is updated so that
the tripleo-common library is installed from git, instead of pypi.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-common/+/869796
Resolves: rhbz#2151943
Change-Id: Ifb2bc6ce3f74f1d06378582d8afc362a9dea007c

deleted_lines: if os.path.exists(authfile): os.environ["REGISTRY_AUTH_FILE"] = authfile else: try: del os.environ["REGISTRY_AUTH_FILE"] except KeyError: pass debug=self.app.options.debug

commit_message:
Allow overriding auth file for buildah command

This change introduces the interface to override the auth file used by
the buildah command. This is required to make sure the authfile option
in the image build command is properly honored.

Related: rhbz#2151943
Change-Id: I2c1ce8de6b7d318eb7e72ecec238fa2fea06c9a6

commit_message:
Refactor generation of tripleo_nova_libvirt_guests

When I initially implemented this, I did not consider just injecting
a variable to content would work according to [1].

How ever the method works without any problem and it allows us to
implement a logic in a much simpler way than repeating the similar
(but slightly different) contents.

[1]
https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/collections/ansible/builtin/copy_module.html#parameter-content
~~~
For advanced formatting or if content contains a variable, use
the ansible.builtin.template module.
~~~

Change-Id: Iad0bcd02cff54058a7a8eb0f6dd026b4737b7c56

commit_message:
Ensure the script is allowed by tox

Currently pep8 job is failing with the following error when tox 4.0 is
used.

pep8: 354 E failed with ./run-flake8 (resolves to ./run-flake8) is not
allowed, use allowlist_externals to allow it

This adds the external command to the allowlist to fix the error.

Change-Id: I695eab2433e6e50bbe3e9c75ac49513b66a2503c

commit_message:
Ironic: Do not use swift when disabled

A few hardware drivers(redfish and iLO) use swift by default. This
ensures usage of swift is disabled in undercloud because swift is no
longer enabled in undercloud.

Change-Id: I54dfee0b61db2cb0b4ad4c3eeb23bc994898239a

commit_message:
Adapt to tox 4.x

skipdist=True does not work with latest tox 4.x.

Also, whitelist_externals was deprecate in favor of the new
allowlist_externals option and is no longer supported by tox 4.x.

Closes-Bug: #2000357
Co-Authored-By: Rabi Mishra <ramishra@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ic0ade281574d78cc78e5c85deaf3afcff0f72e22

commit_message:
Remove leftovers of cinder Dell SC backend

The resource template for Dell SC backend was deprecated because of
renaming (Dell EMC SC backend) and was already removed by [1].

[1] 3699a56891f8abce10d75a1b1cbbd6f2f775ff77

Change-Id: Id86c316cd2a371a56ecc3d5a3a14812c11faa3b4

commit_message:
Cinder: Fix wrong internal parameter to enable Dell/EMC SC backend

The current implementation enables the dell_sc defined types instead of
the dellemc_sc defined types, but the resource parameters defined in
the template expects the dellemc_sc defined type.

Change-Id: I08cca091160b97a148210102ab522c9a06b766b4

commit_message:
Pin tox < 4.0

tox 4.0 was released but unfortunately it introduced breaking changes,
which affect the tox jobs.

This makes sure tox is not updated when installing dependencies.
The tox package installed by the common ensure-tox role was already
pinned by [1].

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/zuul/zuul-jobs/+/866928

Change-Id: Iff5f0227386d4c92c4ad72b4db966851f01f89a1

commit_message:
tripleo_ironic: Make wsgi processes/threads tunable

So that we can configure these options, especially processes, according
to the tht parameter. This also removes redundant override of user and
group.

Change-Id: I11b9816f830739d776d1c64bde6798f48ffc920e

commit_message:
Ironic: Fail when creating a tempurl key fails

Currently the script to create a tempurl key does not return proper
return code and any failure in the script is silently ignored. This
can cause incomplete ironic deployment.

This change adds the proper return code to the script so that
the container (and the deployment step) fails if the key can't be
created.

Change-Id: Ib29d75033e0a0fb876aa70136f73b8defb60b6e1

commit_message:
ironic-api: Fix ignored IronicWorkers

This change fixes the IronicWorkers parameter which has been ignored
since we introduced the tripleo-ansible role to generate apache
config files.

commit_message:
Standalone: Drop parameters for old network port resources

We've replaced deprecated deployed-neutron-port.yaml template in
standalone/undercloud deployment, thus we no longer need the old
DeployedServerPortMap.

This also removes the IPPools parameter, which is no longer used now.
The parameter was previously used to define the additional ip on ovs
bridge but was replaced by the VipPortMap parameter.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/862971
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/862974
Change-Id: I540cfdd0a368d409618d3c3e1be30b636de53177

commit_message:
Replace deprecated deployed-neutron-port.yaml

The deployed-neutron-port.yaml file was already deprecated in favor of
the new deployed(_vip)_port.j2 template.

This change also replaces the port_from_pool.j2 template by the same
deployed_vip_port.j2 so that we use the same implementation for all
vip management in overcloud, undercloud and standalone.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/862970
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/862974
Change-Id: Ic374c4d772bcecb0eca35db184cad25bc00ba7e3

commit_message:
Stop populating DeployedServerPortMap

The DeployedServerPortMap parameter has been already deprecated. This
change completes replacing the deprecated parameter by the new
NodePortMap parameter.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/862971

commit_message:
Make home directory of qemu user consistent with packages

When the qemu user was created by the libvirt package, its home
directory is set to / . However the current ansible task to create
the user does not set the home directory explicitly which results in
using the /home/qemu directory instead. This fixes the inconsistency
and switches back the home directory to follow what is created by
the libvirt package.

This also fixes the missing system user flag, following how the user
is created by the package.

Note that this change implements the same fix as the dependent change
in tripleo-heat-templates.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/856457
Related-Bug: #1989101
Change-Id: I0cb0a1fb1f24d5f470c9f3fba9d7dd5f77ffd359
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible refs/changes/30/864830/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Make home directory of qemu user consistent with packages

When the qemu user was created by the libvirt package, its home
directory is set to / . However the current ansible task to create
the user does not set the home directory explicitly which results in
using the /home/qemu directory instead. This fixes the inconsistency
and switches back the home directory to follow what is created by
the libvirt package.

This also fixes the missing system user flag, following how the user
is created by the package.

Closes-Bug: #1989101
Change-Id: If7e761f85b67055f9e26091c9e2cbd8747c541ab

commit_message:
tripleo_ovn: Add variable to enable vlan transparency

Current tht provides the EnableVLANTransparency parameter to enable
vlan transparency. This change adds the ansible variable corresponding
to that parameter, so that we can easily port the feature.

Change-Id: I1e01dce841500db973ec4ec6060c4e2d77c642ec

commit_message:
Horizon: Switch to PyMemcacheCache backend

MemcachedCache was deprecated in django 3.2[1], and was later removed
in django 4.1[2].

[1] https://github.com/django/django/commit/5ce31d6a7142ca8c76d6b52fa42b3406b9a8ff48
[2] https://github.com/django/django/commit/05f3a6186efefc9fca2204a745b992501c6fd91f

Change-Id: Ie4429a72e72bc56d168011ff490506ee923e1490

commit_message:
overcloud node delete: Fix ignored --overcloud-ssh-port-timeout

The --overcloud-ssh-port-timeout option of the overcloud node delete
command has been unused by any logics actually. This change fixes that
and ensures the option controls ssh timeout during ansible playbook
execution.

Change-Id: I703fc4411008fe83ec62901466a7a2dfaae29daf

commit_message:
Hide diff when the file contains passwords or private keys

... otherwise the secrets can be logged when the file content is
changed.

Change-Id: Ibb29b6959cd54cad4fcc11a7c3f80a5630f5462d

commit_message:
Fix missing trigger for multipathd service

This change ensures any change related to the multipathd service

subject: Horizon: Remove wrong override of memcached_ipv6
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-07-13 00:36:39.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/horizon/horizon-container-puppet.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/de9c9e2ab91e19fbdcd30dd66460e1031095e929', 'message': 'Horizon: Remove wrong override of memcached_ipv6

The memcached_ipv6 hieradata key is set by the memcached service
resource and is present to all services via global_config_settings.
Thus there is no need to override it in individual template.

In addition, the parameter should be set according to IP version used
for memcached service, not for horizon service, thus the current logic
is wrong.

Change-Id: I6f4442c168f2af7bd87b76b6e3a37313d46ad5c7
'}]
commit_message:
Horizon: Remove wrong override of memcached_ipv6

The memcached_ipv6 hieradata key is set by the memcached service
resource and is present to all services via global_config_settings.
Thus there is no need to override it in individual template.

In addition, the parameter should be set according to IP version used
for memcached service, not for horizon service, thus the current logic
is wrong.

Change-Id: I6f4442c168f2af7bd87b76b6e3a37313d46ad5c7

commit_message:
Designate: Add common task for httpd config files

This change adds the common tasks to designate-api container image
build, to ensure Listen directive is disabled in httpd config files,
because now the container includes the httpd package.

Change-Id: I9c755049be2a190b39573b02d2ae1c73329b210b

commit_message:
Test lack of data validation on 'lock', 'migrate' and 'unshelve'
endpoints.

On a request targetted to these endpoints, if the microversion is left
undefined or if it is below the one they are valid from, validation of
the request's body will not trigger and the requests will be answered
with a 202 Accepted message, even though nothing happens from it. This change
adds a series of tempest tests that verify this fact and asserts for the
400 Bad Request message that should come up instead.

Partial-Bug: #2008341
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/nova/+/875653
Change-Id: I512b6f4e7bd7fe9334b1492c6390d4b4ccdd1feb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/50/875650/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_lock_gibberish(self): result = self.client.lock_server(self.s1_id, **{'foo': 'bar'}) # Must unlock the server before asserting for the test to be cleaned up self.client.unlock_server(self.s1_id) self.assertEquals(400, result.response['status'])

commit_message:
This change add several configuration options to enable HTTP checks
to the HAProxy configuration, instead of the default TCP connection
checks (which continue to be the default)

Closes-Bug: #1880610
Change-Id: If7841f710d0dfffdc7ee6b424cb77fc34aeae823

commit_message:
Fix charm for tox4 compatibility

Related-Bug: 2002788
Change-Id: Iecd83b01980d3b9f25da1f5594a009990ef94307
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-gnocchi refs/changes/27/874027/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # We use tox mainly for virtual environment management for test requirements # and do not install the charm code as a Python package into that environment. # Ref: https://tox.wiki/en/latest/config.html#skip_install skip_install = Truepassenv = no_proxy http_proxy https_proxy JUJU_REPOSITORY {toxinidir}/rename.sh# charmcraft clean is done to ensure that # `tox -e build` always performs a clean, repeatable build. # For faster rebuilds during development, # directly run `charmcraft -v pack && ./rename.sh`. charmcraft clean
deleted_lines: skipsdist = True# NOTES: # * We avoid the new dependency resolver by pinning pip < 20.3, see # https://github.com/pypa/pip/issues/9187 # * Pinning dependencies requires tox >= 3.2.0, see # https://tox.readthedocs.io/en/latest/config.html#conf-requires # * It is also necessary to pin virtualenv as a newer virtualenv would still # lead to fetching the latest pip in the func* tox targets, see # https://stackoverflow.com/a/38133283 requires = pip < 20.3 virtualenv < 20.0 setuptools<50.0.0 # NOTE: https://wiki.canonical.com/engineering/OpenStack/InstallLatestToxOnOsci minversion = 3.18.0passenv = no_proxy http_proxy https_proxy JUJU_REPOSITORY install_command = {toxinidir}/pip.sh install {opts} {packages} rename.sh

'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2023-03-10 06:19:12.000000000', 'files': ['.zuul.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance/commit/f31af8b114d14b1e4aa7ee4053f7159c2c41c24f', 'message': 'Disable image volume cache in glance cinder job

Cinder has a image volume cache feature which, when creating a
bootable volume from image, creates an internal volume which
helps facilitate creating the volume from image faster by
cloning the internal volume.

By default, the image cache feature is disabled in cinder[1]
but devstack enables it in gate jobs[2] to make the execution
of tests faster (that create bootable volume from image).

This is causing issues when we create a volume type in a test
and create a bootable volume from that volume type. The internal
image cache volume also uses the same volume type and while
deleting the volume type during teardown, the operation fails
since the internal volume is still using it.

Currently there is no good way to delete an image cache volume
since it's created with the "cinder" user in the "internal" project.
This needs to be fixed on the cinder side but in the meantime,
we will disable image volume cache feature from
glance-multistore-cinder-import job as it doesn't provide
any additional benefit apart from running a few tests faster.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/9cd834798c3b7d4e9171c1cb16fd83d9d32a4225/cinder/volume/driver.py#L324

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tempest/+/875372
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder/+/874865
Change-Id: I0330bb249d22c4c538a13ad5d2311a2fe5ace9fb
'}]
commit_message:
Disable image volume cache in glance cinder job

Cinder has a image volume cache feature which, when creating a
bootable volume from image, creates an internal volume which
helps facilitate creating the volume from image faster by
cloning the internal volume.

By default, the image cache feature is disabled in cinder[1]
but devstack enables it in gate jobs[2] to make the execution
of tests faster (that create bootable volume from image).

This is causing issues when we create a volume type in a test
and create a bootable volume from that volume type. The internal
image cache volume also uses the same volume type and while
deleting the volume type during teardown, the operation fails
since the internal volume is still using it.

Currently there is no good way to delete an image cache volume
since it's created with the "cinder" user in the "internal" project.
This needs to be fixed on the cinder side but in the meantime,
we will disable image volume cache feature from
glance-multistore-cinder-import job as it doesn't provide
any additional benefit apart from running a few tests faster.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/9cd834798c3b7d4e9171c1cb16fd83d9d32a4225/cinder/volume/driver.py#L324
[2] https://github.com/openstack/devstack/blob/69d71cfdf9c24d48fbea366714f4595cbd120723/lib/cinder#L178

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tempest/+/875372
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder/+/874865
Change-Id: I0330bb249d22c4c538a13ad5d2311a2fe5ace9fb

commit_message:
Do not dump detail of container definitions

Some containers such as keystone_bootstrap contains secret information
in the container definitions. We should not dump such details into
ansible output.

Closes-Bug: #1998181
Change-Id: I6c98afc8e0d6822199001ffd9535575a4506b82d
(cherry picked from commit 449faf71a514237bbcff959cc81e0cf9310f7816)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible refs/changes/01/876801/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(tkajinam): Some containers (eg. keystone_bootstrap) contain secrets # in its environments. Hide the output to avoid dumping these # to output. no_log: true

commit_message:
Update block-storage-overview to reflect multiattach

According to https://docs.openstack.org/cinder/latest/admin/volume-multiattach.html,single volume can be attached to multiple
instances simultaneously in active/active or active/standby scenarios.

Change-Id: Ic97f48a30ccbca4e5d903da3843db4896c814c5a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/69/877069/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: like NFS. While traditionally, with the Block Storage service, you can attach a device to only one instance, the introduction of Cinder multiattach in the Queens release allows a single volume to be attached to multiple instances simultaneously in active/active or active/standby scenarios..
deleted_lines: like NFS. With the Block Storage service, you can attach a device to only one instance.

commit_message:
[APIImpact] Add a new glance-builder import method

Implements: blueprint glance-builder-import

Change-Id: Ia35556f6be2092b31034371f92207a2efc43452d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance-specs refs/changes/82/877182/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ====================================================================== Add new import method to create customized flow with selection of user ====================================================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/glance/+spec/glance-builder-import This spec introduces a new import method that enables users to choose plugins which are applied to the image, to create their desired flow. Problem description =================== In Interoperable Image Import, operators can customize the image import process and choose which plugins apply to images. So images will be created with a specific list of plugins. This feature can be extended by implementing new import method, glance-builder, that gives users a chance to select desired plugins that operators develop and create their own customized flow. * Deployer develops plugins * Deployer creates plugins resources * User gets a list of plugin resources * User selects his/her desired plugins * User creates image by specifying the url of the base image and desired plugins in API Proposed change =============== A new import method, glance-builder, needs a base image and a list of plugins comes from users to apply to the image. To get a base image from a url, a new internal plugin does not need to be implemented, the internal plugin, web_download, will be used, so the api import method will be changed to add this internal plugin for glance-builder method. A list of plugins will be got from the body of the import REST API. Plugins data model should be added to the database and an API will be needed to implement CRUD operations for plugins. So the deployer can create plugin resources in the database and users can get a list of plugins to select. Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- To store information about the plugins that are developed and can be selected by users, we need to create the plugins table in the Glance database. To add this table to the database, migration is also needed. Suggested Basic Schema:: Table: plugins +--------------+--------------+------+-----+----------------+ | Field | Type | Null | Key | Extra | +--------------+--------------+------+-----+----------------+ | id | string(36) | NO | PRI | auto_increment | | name | string(255) | NO | UNI | | | description | text | YES | | | | version | string(10 ) | No | | | | created_at | datetime | NO | | | | updated_at | datetime | YES | | | +--------------+--------------+------+-----+----------------+ Fields: id: String that uniquely identified the plugin as the primary key name: The unique name of plugin that users should choose description: Short summary of the change that applies to the image version: Version of plugin created_at: The date and time when the plugin was created updated_at: The date and time when the plugin was updated REST API impact --------------- The glance-builder workflow has two parts: 1. Create image record ( This API does not to be changed ) 2. Issue the Image Import call to complete the import process. Specify glance-builder import method in the body of the import call. * Method: **POST** * Normal http response code: * *202*: import image successfully * Expected error http response codes: * *400*: bad request with details * *401*: Unauthorized * *403*: Forbidden * *404*: Image import process is not enabled * URL: **/v2/images/<image id>/import** * JSON schema for the body: .. code-block:: javascript "method": { "name": { "description": "Name of the method used, here is glance-builder", "type": "string" }, "plugins": { "description": "comma separated list of plugins name", "type": "string" }, "uri": { "description": "http url for downloading base image", "type": "string" } } .. * Example: .. code-block:: javascript "method": { "name": "glance-builder", "plugins": "inject_image_metadata, image_conversion", "uri": "https://cloud-images.ubuntu.com/jammy/current/jammyserver-cloudimg-amd64.img" } .. Add API for creating plugin resource: * Create plugin object * Method: **POST** * Normal http response code: * *201*: plugin created successfully * Expected error http response codes: * *400*: bad request with details * *401*: Unauthorized * *403*: Forbidden * URL: **/v2/plugins** * JSON schema for the body: .. code-block:: javascript { id: { "description": "unique identifier for plugin", "type": "string" }, name: { "description": "unique name for plugin", "type": "string" }, description: { "description": "summary about what plugin does", "type": "string" }, version: { "description": "version number of this plugin", "type": "string" }, } .. * Example: .. code-block:: javascript { "id": "sv173d43-7fdd-e3g2-r5a6-al8bve3b6dsc" "name": "inject_image_metadata" "description": "This plugin inject metadata on image" "version": "1.2" } .. Add API for showing details of plugin resource: * Show plugin * Method: **GET** * Normal http response code: * *200*: show details of plugin successfully * Expected error http response codes: * *400*: bad request with details * *401*: Unauthorized * *403*: Forbidden * *404*: Plugin does not exist * URL: **/v2/plugins/{plugin_id}** * Parameters: plugin_id (id of specific plugin) * JSON schema for the response: .. code-block:: javascript { id: { "description": "unique identifier for plugin", "type": "string" }, name: { "description": "unique name for plugin", "type": "string" }, description: { "description": "summary about what plugin does", "type": "string" }, version: { "description": "version number of this plugin", "type": "string" }, created_at: { "description": "The date and time when the plugin was created", "type": "string" }, updated_at: { "description": "The date and time when the plugin was updated", "type": "string" } } .. * Example: .. code-block:: javascript { "id": "sv173d43-7fdd-e3g2-r5a6-al8bve3b6dsc", "name": "inject_image_metadata", "description": "This plugin inject metadata on image" "version": "1.2" "created_at": "2023-04-09T08:08:08Z", "updated_at": "2023-04-09T08:18:08Z" } .. Add API for listing plugin resources: * List plugins * Method: **GET** * Normal http response code: * *200*: show details of plugin successfully * Expected error http response codes: * *400*: bad request with details * *401*: Unauthorized * *403*: Forbidden * URL: **/v2/plugins/** * JSON schema for the response: .. code-block:: javascript { "plugins" : { "description": "A list of plugin objects", "type": "array" }, "schema" : { "description": "The URL for the schema describing a list of plugins", "type": "string" } } .. * Example: .. code-block:: javascript { "plugins": [ { "id": "sv173d43-7fdd-e3g2-r5a6-al8bve3b6dsc", "name": "inject_image_metadata", "description": "This plugin inject metadate on image" "version": "1.2" "created_at": "2023-04-09T08:08:08Z", "updated_at": "2023-04-09T08:18:08Z" }, { "id": "pr17fd23-7sdj-eeg2-ry46-wf8gb33b6hdc", "name": "image_conversion", "description": "This plugin convert format of image" "version": "1.2" "created_at": "2023-04-09T08:08:08Z", "updated_at": "2023-04-09T08:18:08Z" } ], "schema": "/v2/schemas/plugins" } .. Add API for updating plugin resource: * Update plugin * Method: **PUT** * Normal http response code: * *200*: plugin update successfully * Expected error http response codes: * *400*: bad request with details * *401*: Unauthorized * *403*: Forbidden * *404*: Plugin does not exist * URL: **/v2/plugins/plugin_id** * Parameters: plugin_id (id of specific plugin) * JSON schema for the body: .. code-block:: javascript { plugin: { "description": "plugin object", "type": "object" { name: { "description": "unique name for plugin", "type": "string" }, description: { "description": "summary about what plugin does", "type": "string" }, version: { "description": "version number of this plugin", "type": "string" } } } } .. * Example: .. code-block:: javascript { plugin: { "name": "inject_image_metadata" "description": "This plugin inject metadata on image" "version": "1.5" } } .. * JSON schema for the response: .. code-block:: javascript { plugin: { "description": "plugin object", "type": "object" { id: { "description": "unique identifier for plugin", "type": "string" }, name: { "description": "unique name for plugin", "type": "string" }, description: { "description": "summary about what plugin does", "type": "string" }, version: { "description": "version number of this plugin", "type": "string" }, created_at: { "description": "The date and time when the plugin was created", "type": "string" }, updated_at: { "description": "The date and time when the plugin was updated", "type": "string" } } } } .. * Example: .. code-block:: javascript { plugin: { "id": "sv173d43-7fdd-e3g2-r5a6-al8bve3b6dsc", "name": "inject_image_metadata", "description": "This plugin inject metadata on image" "version": "1.5" "created_at": "2023-04-09T08:08:08Z", "updated_at": "2023-04-10T08:18:08Z" } } .. Add API for deleting plugin resource: * Delete plugin * Method: **DELETE** * Normal http response code: * *204*: delete plugin successfully * Expected error http response codes: * *400*: bad request with details * *401*: Unauthorized * *403*: Forbidden * *404*: Plugin does not exist * URL: **/v2/plugins/plugin_id** * Parameters: plugin_id (id of specific plugin) Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- Users can see a list of plugins via the updated python-glanceclient. They can also use a new import method, glance-builder, and choose which plugins apply to the base image via client. Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- glance-builder method should be enabled in glance-api.conf Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: amnik-open Work Items ---------- * Glance: * Patch _internal_plugins/__init__.py to return the web_download plugin if import method is glance-builder * Implement get_chosen_import_plugins(\*\*kwargs) function in plugins/__init__.py to get the list of selected plugins from API * Patch the api image import to add internal plugin, web_download, and plugins come from the API to the flow if the import method is the glance-builder * Add plugin resource data model to the database * Implement list, show, create, update and delete api for plugin resource * Implement migration to add plugin table to the database * Write unit/functional tests * Update documentation * Glance-Client: * Add support for glance-builder method * Add support for plugins CRUD operations * Update documentation Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= * Unit and functional tests in Glance * Tempest tests needed Documentation Impact ==================== Glance documentation should be updated to add glance-builder method. References ========== The new glance-builder method provides base capability to implement something like EC2 image builder product: .. [1] https://aws.amazon.com/image-builder/

commit_message:
Fix access to configs hash symbol in get_auth_endpoint

The hash returned by the request method of Puppet::Provider::Openstack
uses symbols instead of strings as keys, see [1].

This prepends the missing ':' in front of the 'auth.auth_url' key to
make it a symbol and to have it return the actual value instead of
always coming back empty.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstacklib/src/commit/a1dfd6861f9593f005e72acaef7262e618d2cf6c/lib/puppet/provider/openstack.rb#L123

Closes-Bug: #2010894

Change-Id: I97546a1030559d1f91030a668106e220ce7a7650
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-keystone refs/changes/03/877103/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
iscsi: Use assert on checks for readability

assert will also fail when we're not meeting the conditions, makes
clear what we're actually testing, and isn't listed as a skipped task
when the condition is ok.

Change I940b1d3eceb98e16fa366c243672f588b1412d70 dropped CentOS 7,
so now we're just asserting that it's not RedHat.

Change-Id: Iec4e9a6922b67f7c9eb79f580fffbcc8160529e9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/96/869596/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Update tox.ini to work with tox 4

Tox 4 deprecated whitelist_externals.
Replace whitelist_externals with allowlist_externals
Tox 4 Fail on pass_env/passenv entries containing whitespace.
Updated passenv with comma separated values

Also, we need to temporary turn off coverage job, since it compares
stats of current change with a previous one. It is impossible to collect
stats for previous commit, since it does not include tox fixes.

Signed-off-by: Arnaud Morin <arnaud.morin@ovhcloud.com>
Change-Id: I821d846543f1dd55564358550fa074333f8b741b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally-openstack refs/changes/86/871586/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: whitelist_externals = findpassenv = http_proxy HTTP_PROXY https_proxy HTTPS_PROXY no_proxy NO_PROXY REQUESTS_CA_BUNDLE

commit_message:
Change the release tag to use the release identification

According to the TC resolution [1] and the release identification
document [2], the release number will be used as primary identifier in
the development cycle. Release name will be used in marketing.

[1]https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20220524-release-identification-process.html
[2]https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/release-naming.html

Change-Id: Ia3da9bf6d6113edacb0e21de9a51bd60d5e2465b

commit_message:
ignore deleted server groups in validation

This change simply catches the exception raised when
we lookup a servergroup via a hint and the validation
upcall is enabled.

Change-Id: I858b4da35382a9f4dcf88f4b6db340e1f34eb82d
Closes-Bug: #1890244
(cherry picked from commit cd2c2f359bbd4913cfe73199847bc35b2664aaa9)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/89/867989/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2017 Ericsson # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. from nova import context from nova import objects from nova import test from nova.tests import fixtures as nova_fixtures from nova.tests.functional import fixtures as func_fixtures from nova.tests.functional import integrated_helpers class IgnoreDeletedServerGroupsTest( test.TestCase, integrated_helpers.InstanceHelperMixin, ): """Regression test for bug 1890244 If instance are created as member of server groups it should be possibel to evacuate them if the server groups are deleted prior to the host failure. """ def setUp(self): super().setUp() # Stub out external dependencies. self.useFixture(nova_fixtures.NeutronFixture(self)) self.useFixture(nova_fixtures.GlanceFixture(self)) self.useFixture(func_fixtures.PlacementFixture()) # Start nova controller services. api_fixture = self.useFixture(nova_fixtures.OSAPIFixture( api_version='v2.1')) self.api = api_fixture.admin_api self.start_service('conductor') # Use a custom weigher to make sure that we have a predictable # scheduling sort order. self.useFixture(nova_fixtures.HostNameWeigherFixture()) self.start_service('scheduler') # Start two computes, one where the server will be created and another # where we'll evacuate it to. self.src = self._start_compute('host1') self.dest = self._start_compute('host2') self.notifier = self.useFixture( nova_fixtures.NotificationFixture(self) ) def test_evacuate_after_group_delete(self): # Create an anti-affinity group for the server. body = { 'server_group': { 'name': 'test-group', 'policies': ['anti-affinity'] } } group_id = self.api.api_post( '/os-server-groups', body).body['server_group']['id'] # Create a server in the group which should land on host1 due to our # custom weigher. body = {'server': self._build_server()} body['os:scheduler_hints'] = {'group': group_id} server = self.api.post_server(body) server = self._wait_for_state_change(server, 'ACTIVE') self.assertEqual('host1', server['OS-EXT-SRV-ATTR:host']) # Down the source compute to enable the evacuation self.api.microversion = '2.11' # Cap for the force-down call. self.api.force_down_service('host1', 'nova-compute', True) self.api.microversion = 'latest' self.src.stop() # assert the server currently has a server group reqspec = objects.RequestSpec.get_by_instance_uuid( context.get_admin_context(), server['id']) self.assertIsNotNone(reqspec.instance_group) self.assertIn('group', reqspec.scheduler_hints) # then delete it so that we need to clean it up on evac self.api.api_delete(f'/os-server-groups/{group_id}') # Initiate evacuation server = self._evacuate_server( server, expected_host='host2', expected_migration_status='done' ) reqspec = objects.RequestSpec.get_by_instance_uuid( context.get_admin_context(), server['id']) self.assertIsNone(reqspec.instance_group) self.assertNotIn('group', reqspec.scheduler_hints)

added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============================= Add disable/enable device API ============================= https://blueprints.launchpad.net/openstack-cyborg/+spec/disable-enable-device Nowadays, Cyborg discovers the device on compute node by each driver. All devices matching the spec of driver are discovered and reported to the Placement service as an accelerator resources. This spec proposes a set of new APIs which allow admin users to disable/enable a device. Problem description =================== Cyborg maintains a configuration file to configure the enabled drivers. Once the driver is enabled, the agent will discover all devices whose vendor ID, device ID match the driver's requirement. If admin user do not want all devices to be used by virtual machine, there is no way to disable a device currently. Use Cases --------- * Alice is an admin user, she wants some FPGAs to be reserved for its own use and not allow them to be allocated to a VM at the time. For example, she wants to program the FPGA device and use it as the OVS agent running on the host. Proposed change =============== We propose to add new API in order to enable/disable a device. If the device is disabled, Cyborg will report this device as a reserved resource to Placement, so that Nova can not schedule to this device. On the contrary, if the device is enabled, the device should become available and the 'reserved' field in Placement shoule be set to 0. * Since the API layer is modified, a new microversion should be introduced. * It also need a new field "is_maintaining" in Device object and data model to indicate whether the device is disbaled. If one device is disabled, the "is_maintaining" field should be set to "True", and if the device is enabled, the field should be set to "False". The default value should be "False". * Cyborg need call Placement API to update the "reserved" field for the device in this API. * Add "is_maintaining" field's value check during conductor's periodic report. Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- A new column `is_maintaining` should be added in Device's data model. REST API impact --------------- A microversion need to be introduced since the Device API changed. List Device API ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ * Return a device list URL: ``/devices`` METHOD: ``GET`` Return: 200 .. code-block:: { "devices": [ { "uuid": "d2446439-0142-40b7-9eee-82d855f453d9", "type": "FPGA", "vendor": "0xABCD", "model": "miss model info", "std_board_info": "{"device_id": "0xabcd", "class": "Fake class"}", "vendor_board_info": "fake_vendor_info", "hostname": "devstack01", "links": [ { "href": "http://172.23.97.140/accelerator/v2/devices/d2446439-0142-40b7-9eee-82d855f453d9", "rel": "self" } ], "created_at": "2021-11-03T08:48:43+00:00", "updated_at": null } ] } Get Device API ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ * Get a device by uuid and return the details URL: ``/devices/{uuid}`` METHOD: ``GET`` Return: 200 .. code-block:: { "uuid": "d2446439-0142-40b7-9eee-82d855f453d9", "type": "FPGA", "vendor": "0xABCD", "model": "miss model info", "std_board_info": "{"device_id": "0xabcd", "class": "Fake class"}", "vendor_board_info": "fake_vendor_info", "hostname": "devstack01", "links": [ { "href": "http://172.23.97.140/accelerator/v2/devices/d2446439-0142-40b7-9eee-82d855f453d9", "rel": "self" } ], "created_at": "2021-11-03T08:48:43+00:00", "updated_at": null } Disable Device API ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ * Disable a device URL: ``/devices/disable/{device_uuid}`` METHOD: ``POST`` Return: 200 Error Code: 404(the device is not found),403(the role is not admin) Enable Device API ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ * Enable a device URL: ``/devices/enable/{device_uuid}`` METHOD: ``POST`` Return: 200 Error Code: 404(the device is not found),403(the role is not admin) Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- The deployer need update Cyborg to the microversion which supports disable/enable API. Otherwise the disable/enable API will be rejected. Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Xinran Wang(xin-ran.wang@intel.com) Work Items ---------- * Add new column `is_maintaining` for device table. * Add disable/enable API in DeviceController. * Update the RP `reserved` field according to the operation. For `disable` oparation, the `reserved` field need be set by the same value as the `total` field, and for `enable` operation, the `reserved` field will be set to zero. * Update GET/LIST device API with `is_maintaining` field added in returned value. * Add disable/enable operation in cyborgclient. * Add unit tests. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Need add unit test, and tempest test if needed. Documentation Impact ==================== Need add related docs. References ========== None History ======= Optional section intended to be used each time the spec is updated to describe new design, API or any database schema updated. Useful to let reader understand what's happened along the time. .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Release Name - Description * - Xena - Introduced * - Yoga - Reproposed

added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ================================== Cyborg Xilinx FPGA Driver Proposal ================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/openstack-cyborg/+spec/add-xilinx-fpga-driver This spec proposes to provide the initial design for Cyborg's Xilinx FPGA driver. Problem description =================== We want to use Cyborg manage the Xilinx FPGA devices, but there is not driver for it, and we want to add the Xilinx FPGA driver to support managing Xilinx FPGA devices by Cyborg. Use Cases --------- * As an operator, I would like to use Cyborg agent starts or does resource checking periodically, the Cyborg Xilinx FPGA driver should provide ``discover()`` function to enumerate the list of the Xilinx FPGA devices, and report the details of all available Xilinx FPGA accelerators on the host, such as PID(Product id), VID(Vendor id), Device. * As a user, I would like to boot up a VM with Xilinx FPGA device. Cyborg should be able to manage this kind of acceleration resources, assign it to the VM(binding) and programming it. Proposed changes ================ Xilinx FPGA is PCIe based platform that is comprised of physical partitions called Shell and User. The Shell has two physical functions: privileged PF0 also called mgmt pf and non-privileged PF1 also called user pf. Shell provides basic infrastructure for the Alveo platform. User partition (otherwise known as PR-Region) contains user compiled binary.[1]_ User PF is only displayed after installing Xilinx driver `xrt`. And the difference between the PCI address of user PF and mgmt PF is the func field. For example, pci address of mgmt PF is '0000:3b:00.0', and the address of user PF is '0000:3b:00.1'. The func field increase 1. So the pci address of user PF can be calculated by the address of mgmt PF. This calculation rule also applies to 'product'. From the above description, the Xilinx FPGA driver should implement the following methods: - ``discover()``: This function works by executing ``lspci`` command and reports devices' raw info sample as following:: [ { "vendor": "10ee", "product": "5000", "device": "0000:3b:00.0" } ] In above example, "5000" is the mgmt PF. So the driver should add three traits for one device, including "CUSTOM_FPGA_<VENDOR_ID>", "CUSTOM_FPGA_PRODUCT_ID_<ID>". Also the driver should create records in deployable table only for the device. For now, only when both mgmt PF and user PF are binded to one vm, and end user can program the FPGA device. So there are two attach handles when binding it to vm. - ``program()``: This function works by executing ``xbmgmt program`` command which is included with the XRT installation package.[2]_ Also, this function should be called for pre-program before binding to vm. Below is the objects to describe a FPGA device which complies with the Cyborg database mode and Placement data model. :: Hardware Driver objects Placement data model | | | 1 FPGA 1 devices | | | | | 1 deployable ---> resource_provider | | ---> parent resource_provider: compute node | | | 1 FPGA 2 attach_handle ---> inventories(total:1) Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- Xilinx FPGA driver will not touch Data model. The Cyborg Agent can call Xilinx FPGA driver to update the database during the discover, bind and unbind operations. REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- * Add new driver xilinx_fpga_driver to enabled_drivers for agent. Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Eric Xie Work Items ---------- * Implement Xilinx FPGA driver in Cyborg * Add related test cases. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======== * Unit tests will be added to test this driver. Documentation Impact ==================== Document Xilinx FPGA driver in Cyborg project. Test report in Cyborg wiki References ========== .. [1]: https://xilinx.github.io/XRT/master/html/platforms.html .. [2]: https://xilinx.github.io/XRT/master/html/xbmgmt2.html History ======= .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Release - Description * - Yoga - Introduced

commit_message:
Migrate instance_name_template to the base class

The [DEFAULT] instance_name_template parameter is used not only by
nova-api but by other services like nova-conductor or nova-compute.
This change migrate the parameter from the api class to the base class
so that users can configure the parameter for all services.

Backport note:
This avoids deprecating the existing parameter in stable branch.

Change-Id: I0f590f12017e743a17d989d3a1008faa9b840e87
(cherry picked from commit 73eb553202e77ca3073764bb863cc07adc7f32c4)

added_lines: --- deprecations: - | The ``nova::api::instance_name_template`` parameter has been deprecated. Use the ``nova::instance_name_template`` parameter instead so that the option is configured for all nova services.

commit_message:
yumrepo: Replace old enabled parameter

This module now supports only Puppet 5 or newer versions thus we no
longer need compatibility with Puppet 3.x (or even older).

Change-Id: Icfa19e80c33a87df76a56f23bba4b93709cdb7a7

commit_message:
add list device testcase by combine args

add list device testcase by combine condition of type、hostname、vendor
Change-Id: I9ac0eb1b40b041fb904036b4749bf3faa872e32e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cyborg-tempest-plugin refs/changes/30/872530/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_list_devices_filter_by_combine_args(self): # list devices filter by combine args response = self.os_admin.cyborg_client.list_devices() type_name = response['devices'][0]['type'] vendor = response['devices'][0]['vendor'] hostname = response['devices'][0]['hostname'] params = { "type": type_name", "hostname": hostname, "vendor": vendor } response = self.os_admin.cyborg_client.list_devices(params=params) self.assertNotEmpty(response['devices']) for dv in response['devices']: self.assertEqual(type_name, dv['type']) self.assertEqual(vendor, dv['vendor']) self.assertEqual(hostname, dv['hostname'])

commit_message:
arq bind and unbound support vGPU

This patch is part of the vGPU support feature in cyborg.
It implements arq bind and unbind for vGPU resource.

Co-Authored-By: Wenping Song <songwenping@inspur.com>

Change-Id: I32c3b81345c6ce83834a83c64b88e37926724f16
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cyborg refs/changes/57/771757/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import json from cyborg.agent.rpcapi import AgentAPI # if attach_handle is a vgpu, create the mdev in the sys path if ah.attach_type == 'MDEV': attach_info = json.loads(ah.attach_info) pci_addr = "{}:{}:{}.{}".format( attach_info['domain'], attach_info['bus'], attach_info['device'], attach_info['function']) hostname = self.arq.hostname asked_type = attach_info['asked_type'] agent = AgentAPI() agent.create_mdev( context, hostname, pci_addr, asked_type, ah.uuid) hostname = arq.hostname if attach_handle.attach_type == 'MDEV': attach_info = json.loads(attach_handle.attach_info) pci_addr = "{}:{}:{}.{}".format( attach_info['domain'], attach_info['bus'], attach_info['device'], attach_info['function']) agent = AgentAPI() agent.remove_vgpu_mdev( context, hostname, pci_addr, attach_info['asked_type'], attach_handle.uuid)

commit_message:
Cyborg NVIDIA GPU Driver support vGPU management

The Cyborg NVIDIA GPU Driver has implemented pGPU management in
the Train release, this patch implements the vGPU management
support in the same driver. For specs about this feature, please
refer to [0].

[0]:https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/cyborg-specs/specs/wallaby/approved/vgpu-driver-proposal.html

Co-Authored-By: Wenping Song <songwenping@inspur.com>

implement blueprint enable-vgpu-in-cyborg

Change-Id: I715fdad3e8601186b5c6e8c087f27fb91d679490

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/2023.1

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/2023.1 branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: If7c27d978281817d022f6ecac276386cc7951fa8

commit_message:
Update master for stable/2023.1

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/2023.1.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/2023.1.

Sem-Ver: feature
Change-Id: If57c289b2e8e411504b187add037e7c1c1b0d54e

commit_message:
fix wrong error type in glance metadef tests

since xena the return type changed for some tests. See this commit message for the changes:
https://github.com/openstack/glance/commit/99331d7efacb556effc9dda2a7db06bdc6af0319
For this reason some patrole tests fail, because they await a 403 but now a 404 is send.

Change-Id: I2fe03fc3820b6c2e3679130ef2857eb740f4aaeb

commit_message:
WIP: Add a hacking check for policy names in one module only

This patchset adds a hacking check to Patrole to validate that
policy names are tested in one module only to avoid poor test
organization: a set of policies related to an API or to multiple
APIs should be tested together.

Change-Id: I1da694bd449d88626597dfc533c4dd6699879e85
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/patrole refs/changes/62/574062/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: POLICY_NAME_RE = re.compile(r'.*rule\=[\'\"]{1}.*[\'\"]{1}') _HAVE_RBAC_DECORATOR = False _SEEN_POLICY_NAMES = {} global _HAVE_RBAC_DECORATOR _HAVE_RBAC_DECORATOR = True if not _HAVE_RBAC_DECORATOR: _HAVE_RBAC_DECORATOR = Falsedef unique_policy_tests_per_module(physical_line, filename): """Check that test cases don't use "self.client" to define a client. P104 """ if "patrole_tempest_plugin/tests/api" in filename: if POLICY_NAME_RE.match(physical_line): try: candidate = POLICY_NAME_RE.findall(physical_line)[0].strip() policy_name = candidate.split('=')[-1].replace( '\"', '').replace('\'', '') except Exception: pass else: _SEEN_POLICY_NAMES.setdefault(policy_name, filename) other_filename = _SEEN_POLICY_NAMES[policy_name] # The same policy can be tested in a positive and negative test # module. if sum('_negative' in x for x in ( filename, other_filename)) == 1: return component = filename.split('/')[4] other_component = other_filename.split('/')[4] # The same policy can be tested across different components. # Do not assume different components have distinct policy # names. if component != other_component: return if filename != _SEEN_POLICY_NAMES[policy_name]: return 0, ("Each policy must be tested in one module only." " Policy: %s is tested in %s and %s. It should " "only be tested in one module." % ( policy_name, filename, _SEEN_POLICY_NAMES[policy_name])) register(unique_policy_tests_per_module)
deleted_lines: have_rbac_decorator = False global have_rbac_decorator have_rbac_decorator = True if not have_rbac_decorator: have_rbac_decorator = False

commit_message:
Make rbac_utils is_admin more robust

This makes is_admin in rbac_utils more robust by doing
a context_is_admin check to determine admin-ness rather than
simply checking whether the RBAC role under test is the
admin role configured in Tempest.

Change-Id: I544b228b3e0896c93c601b509aabce9c78e647ae

commit_message:
Move service validation to rbac_rule_validation

This patchset moves service validation helper function out of
policy_authority module into rbac_rule_validation, because
service validation should be placed in a high-level module
that covers both policy_authority and requirements_authority.

Additionally, the service validation logic is refactored
to use Tempest's get_service_list() under tempest.common.utils
because:

* this approach is configuration driven
* more efficient
* simpler
* uses supported Tempest function

The unit tests are also moved and refactored as appropriate.

Change-Id: I330e1e047e0be73b40d06a3c04caa204ab92d984

Mark raw strings as such

This is raising warnings now and will be an error in future versions of
Python 3.

Based off https://review.openstack.org/#/c/580633/1

to incorporate those that have recently been added to Neutron's
policy file (because they were missing):

This includes updating relevant tests with the following policies:

* "create_router:external_gateway_info"

"create_router:external_gateway_info:network_id"

The approach taken is to create new feature flags for the new
policies and apply them to existing tests. This makes it easier
to maintain the tests but does result in the tests getting
skipped for previous releases of OpenStack that don't have
these "newer" policies. However, it is unlikely that policy
will be changed for older releases of OpenStack.

The alternative approach is [1] which leads to a lot of test
maintenance overhead: each combination of the set of all
the policies enforced per test needs to be accounted for
across n, n-1, and n-2, which is quite difficult to maintain.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/584102/5

commit_message:
Update policies for some port/router network tests

This patch set updates policies for some port/router network tests
to incorporate those that have recently been added to Neutron's
policy file (because they were missing):

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/577471/5

This includes updating relevant tests with the following policies:

* "create_port:fixed_ips"
* "update_port:fixed_ips"
* "create_router:external_gateway_info"

Also adds a new test for the following policy:

"create_router:external_gateway_info:network_id"

The approach taken is to create new feature flags for the new
policies and apply them to existing tests. This makes it easier
to maintain the tests but does result in the tests getting
skipped for previous releases of OpenStack that don't have
these "newer" policies. However, it is unlikely that policy
will be changed for older releases of OpenStack.

The alternative approach is [1] which leads to a lot of test
maintenance overhead: each combination of the set of all
the policies enforced per test needs to be accounted for
across n, n-1, and n-2, which is quite difficult to maintain.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/584102/5

Change-Id: I679fca4d10a0398cc66755ef428fa7b0bd77195d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/patrole refs/changes/02/584102/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: "create_router:external_gateway_info", "create_router:external_gateway_info", def test_create_router_external_gateway_fixed_ips(self): @rbac_rule_validation.action( service="neutron", rules=["create_router", "create_router:external_gateway_info", "create_router:external_gateway_info:network_id"], expected_error_codes=[404, 403, 403, 403]) @decorators.idempotent_id('f1fc5a23-e3d8-44f0-b7bc-47006ad9d3d4') def test_create_router_external_gateway_info_network_id(self): """Create Router External Gateway Info Network Id RBAC test for the neutron create_router:external_gateway_info:network_id policy """ name = data_utils.rand_name(self.__class__.__name__ + '-snat-router') external_gateway_info = {'network_id': self.network['id']} with self.rbac_utils.override_role(self): router = self.routers_client.create_router( name=name, external_gateway_info=external_gateway_info) self.addCleanup(self.routers_client.delete_router, router['router']['id'])

subject: Add distinct conf opt groups for both validation methodologies
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-07-08 17:05:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/patrole/commit/e56bac32c6761f67ac27b40ecf57fc280a9ccae9', 'message': 'Add distinct conf opt groups for both validation methodologies

This patchset adds a distinct group for each of the validation
methodologies:

  * oslo.policy approach => policy_validation
  * custom requirements approach => requirements_validation

policy_validation receives the following options:

  * custom_policy_files

requirements_validation receives the following options:

  * custom_requirements_file
  * test_custom_requirements

Background: In the initial Patrole spec for project creation submitted
to qa-specs [0] there is much discussion about oslo.policy-driven vs.
requirements-driven approach to RBAC validation. Long story short:
Patrole by default does oslo.policy validation but later added
requirements-driven validation [1]. However, the options for both
ways of doing validation should be made as distinct as possible to
avoid confusion between which options to use for which validation
methods.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/382672/
[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/477014/

Change-Id: I2f3205976fb7f690f967cb30570ed9b1bec8293f

commit_message:
Add distinct conf opt groups for both validation methodologies

This patchset adds a distinct group for each of the validation
methodologies:

  * oslo.policy approach => policy_validation
  * custom requirements approach => requirements_validation

policy_validation receives the following options:

  * custom_policy_files

requirements_validation receives the following options:

  * custom_requirements_file
  * test_custom_requirements

Background: In the initial Patrole spec for project creation submitted
to qa-specs [0] there is much discussion about oslo.policy-driven vs.
requirements-driven approach to RBAC validation. Long story short:
Patrole by default does oslo.policy validation but later added
requirements-driven validation [1]. However, the options for both
ways of doing validation should be made as distinct as possible to
avoid confusion between which options to use for which validation
methods.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/382672/
[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/477014/

Change-Id: I2f3205976fb7f690f967cb30570ed9b1bec8293f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/patrole refs/changes/68/580868/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: for group, opts in pconfig.list_opts(): config.register_opt_group( conf, group, opts) return [(group.name, opts) for group, opts in pconfig.list_opts()]
deleted_lines: config.register_opt_group( conf, pconfig.patrole_group, pconfig.PatroleGroup) config.register_opt_group( conf, pconfig.patrole_log_group, pconfig.PatroleLogGroup) config.register_opt_group( conf, pconfig.policy_feature_enabled, pconfig.PolicyFeatureEnabledGroup) return [ (pconfig.patrole_group.name, pconfig.PatroleGroup), (pconfig.policy_feature_enabled.name, pconfig.PolicyFeatureEnabledGroup) ]

commit_message:
Improve unit tests for policy authority module

This patch set improves unit tests for policy authority module:

- adds better/more intuitive resource policy files
- adds tests for validating oslo.policy GenericCheck checks by
  passing in additional metadata

Change-Id: I7cf3a294a038268fe8fa3119981f282f782b2a74
